newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - September 27.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland - September 27.

text.p: Following are the highlights of stories reported in the Irish press on Friday.
- The government welcomed the decision of the Irish Congress of Trade Unions (ICTU) to enter talks on a new national wage agreement.
- Irish national carrier Aer Lingus is close to completing a deal to sell 60 percent of its Airmotive subsidiary to the German airline Lufthansa.
- The Irish pound fell again in foreign exchange markets on Thursday with some participants saying they saw signs of the central bank intervening to sell the currency.
- Diarmuid O'Neill, the suspected IRA terrorist shot dead in London ths week, had strong connections with the Basque area where the separatist guerrilla organisation ETA is active.
- Guinness brands, including its flagship stout and top-selling lagers Carlsberg and Budweiser, have increased their share of the buoyant irish beer market this year, the company said on Thursday.

- The umbrella body for Irish accountants said in its pre-budget submission to the government that the tax system must be used innovatively to initiate, encourage and develop indigenous and foreign enterprises to increase job opportunities in Ireland.
